Reviews.Title: “Not 4 star”
Reviews.Author: Spain S
Reviews.Content: Obviously, it's an airport hotel so we weren't expecting spectacular but we were still disappointed. Room was adequate and obviously fairly recently refurbished but not clean (hairs on bathroom floor, toilet not clean) Also the soundproofing was poor (would hope for better in an airport hotel where guests arrive at all hours) and the television was an old style one with a loose cable that would suddenly go off for no reason. Wifi signal only available in one corner of the room and we had to phone and ask for the wifi code: surely scribbling it on the room card as a matter of course would be better service? would save waiting until the receptionist answered the phone, which took a while as presumably they were busy. Having said that the price was reasonable, parking was convenient and reception staff were efficient and friendly. Average says it all really.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant 'night before flight', airport suburb, friendly "town" feel.”
Reviews.Author: veomar
Reviews.Content: In other words, it doesn't feel as though you're in the capital. A very pleasant summer evening here, before flying out early the next morning. The reception staff were great, especially the manager who knew more and was very professional. The young female receptionist was under training and didn't really have much of a clue at the time - we requested to pay the bill on arrival instead of at 4.30 a.m. as it was an early flight - she clearly wasn't used to such questions!! Nonetheless she didn't serve us badly after checking with the manager. Room medium-sized with comfortable double bed as requested - not those separate twins which they always seem to give you unless otherwise requested. General stay very good indeed - the local square with its various restaurants, bars and typical mid-20th Century 'Madrileno' architecture is particularly recommended for am evening stroll and drink or light meal. I recommend 'La Plaza' for its choice, relatively reasonable prices (for Madrid) and the service from its most amenable young waiter. All in all: much more enjoyable than some anonymous plastic brick cube on the outlying parts of an airport. Visit this 'barrio' - you should enjoy it! Just one (and only one) complaint - not enough coffee at the early breakfast; most pots were empty or nearly empty. Could have been organised and staffed better, but there again it was quite early, and what does one expect in the middle of a recession... Would go back any time if the deal was as good as the one we found on 'atrapalo'. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Shuttle service needs improvement”
Reviews.Author: Jen K
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Clement Barajas for one night, since I had an overnight layover in Madrid on my way home to the U.S. Before leaving, I contacted the hotel to inquire about how to arrange the shuttle service, since I knew my phone would not work in Spain. I received a prompt response from an employee, who informed me that the information desk at the airport would be able to contact the hotel for me upon my arrival so the shuttle could meet me. When my flight arrived an hour late (at 12:30 AM), I inquired at the information desk about calling the hotel for the shuttle. The information desk told me that they would not make any calls, and directed me to a pay phone. When I called the hotel, they informed me that it was not possible for the shuttle to come and meet me - as service stops at 1 AM. When I pointed out that it was 12:40 AM and the shuttle should operate for another 20 minutes, the employee of Clement Barajas said that since the driver would likely not return to the hotel by 1 AM, it was not possible for him to come and meet me and that I was on my own to find transportation to the hotel. I understand that the shuttle does not operate 24 hours per day - but if the service is advertised until 1 AM, it should run until that time. The hotel itself was fine - the location was very convenient and the room was perfect for my needs. However, it would serve the hotel to clarify their policies regarding the shuttle and make them more efficient to eliminate stress from guests coming to their hotel. I had no problems with the hotel, but unfortunately my experience with the employee of Clement Barajas and the shuttle will prevent me from staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “all around great”
Reviews.Author: greengrad
Reviews.Content: Is it weird to be so enthusiastic about what is basically an airport hotel? This place was nicer, cleaner AND cheaper than some of the other places my husband and i stayed during our vacation. its location near the airport is very convenient and there is a shuttle service. the breakfast was good and there is a little park within walking distance if you have some time to kill.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the airport good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mo-Oxford
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 nights before driving down to Murcia in south Spain. The hotel is in close proximity to the airport and there is a shuttle service. The rooms in the hotel are good sized and very clean. Staff were very pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the airport”
Reviews.Author: ShrimpersNo1
Reviews.Content: I arrived at Madrid airport, called the hotel + a shuffle coach came to pick me up within minutes. The receptionist was really pleasant and helpful, the room was comfortable and nicely decorated, there was free water, soft drinks + orange in the room + there were free film channels on the TV. Breakfast next morning was fine + they were really helpful with onward directions + advice. Finally and critically it was inexpensive. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for airport link”
Reviews.Author: bernipops
Reviews.Content: We were picked up from the airport fairly promptly by the shuttle bus (cross over the road from the arrivals hall and you will find a "pull in" for hotel shuttles with a board showing all hotel telephone numbers - call hotel and they will send the bus for you). Reception was efficient and friendly. Room was a good size with all the amenities you would need for an overnight stay. Turn left out of the hotel and there are several bars/restaurants and a large supermarket. Turn right out of the hotel and there is a small supermarket and several shops. Continue down the road further to the end and you will find a square with quite a few bars. It is a busy square but we sat and had a few drinks in the evening and were given free tapas. There is also a regular bus service to Avenida Americas in Madrid (about every 5-10 minutes). Barajas is a lovely town and bigger than it looks if you just stay local to the hotel. We pre-booked our shuttle back to the airport for 5.00 am and were pleased to find coffee and cakes available in reception before we left. We would definitely recommend this hotel and stay there again if in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - near airport!”
Reviews.Author: Remije
Reviews.Content: We spent the night at this hotel in between flights. It was great! Very comfortable. The staff was extremely accomodating and helpful. The rooms were small especially as there were 3 of us. The beds were comfortable. The rooms were very nicely decorated. The metro was just a 10 minute walk from the hotel and we were able to enjoy an afternoon and evening in Madrid. The metro ride was about 30 min and cost us 2 euro each. The Madrid metro system is one of the best that we have seen - clean, efficient and extremely easy to get around on. The hotel sent a shuttle to pick us up at the airport and there was a shuttle to take us back in the morning - free of charge. Overall, for our needs, this hotel was great. Also, great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: mian11224
Reviews.Content: It is not a luxury hotel, but the rooms are quite spacious and clean. Getting to the center of the city takes some time, but if it's a very good choice between the flights. There are several hotels in this area, so they all share the advantages of the location: close to the airport, shuttle, residential area with numerous shops and eateries (btw, a place in the square serves kangaroo meat, quite tasty). However Clement has several other big pluses: very friendly and helpful staff, excellent free Internet connection, and complimentary mini-bar - a nice touch when you arrive late at a hot night. A warning: reserve a shuttle seat, it could be full, although a taxi to the airport is not expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay if you need a plane to take...”
Reviews.Author: HarleyMariakerke
Reviews.Content: This hotel close to the Madrid airport is apparently used for transit purposes. Clean room and kindly staff at the reception. Too far away from the city center if that would be you target. It takes approx. 20 minutes by taxi to get into Madrid center and even up to 40 – 45 minutes by metro. There are some small restaurants nearby. Breakfast is at 6 Euro, but even that is overpaid for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “free shuttle and near metro”
Reviews.Author: ohdesi74
Reviews.Content: If you have a night before or after a flight, and are looking for somewhere convenient to stay, this hotel is a very good choice. Nice rooms with complimentary mini-bar, There are several restaurants near the hotel, and should you want to visit Madrid centre, it can easily be reached with the metro. It is about a 10 min walk to get the metro. There is a free shuttle bus to and from the hotel - when you arrive at Barajas airport you simply call the hotel and they tell you where to go.

Reviews.Title: “perfect service!”
Reviews.Author: LigaKrista
Reviews.Content: the staff was very helpful, everything was clean and we got anything we asked for (f.e. salt in the middle of night)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: japlaza
Reviews.Content: Stayed here just for one night, excellent hotel and staff. Got a room with a small terrace, excellent a/c, safe deposit, etc. You can walk from the Barajas Metro Sta, although is about 3/4 mile. Free timely shuttle from/to airport

Reviews.Title: “Super!”
Reviews.Author: AmarillaArvika
Reviews.Content: If you have a night before or after a flight, and are looking for somewhere convenient to stay, this hotel is a very good choice. Nice rooms with complimentary mini-bar, english-speaking and very helpful staff and great breakfast. There are several restaurants near the hotel, and should you want to visit Madrid centre, it can easily be reached with the metro. There is a free shuttle bus to and from the hotel - when you arrive at Barajas airport you simply call the hotel and they tell you where to go. For trips back to the airport the shuttle needs to be booked in advance through reception.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for early / late flights from Madrid”
Reviews.Author: cen811
Reviews.Content: We stayed here between flights from Madrid Barajas airport and were pleasantly surprised with a true 4* hotel experience literally 5 minutes from the airport on a free, reliable shuttle bus. The online booking gave us a 6 euro voucher ultimately making the rate a very appealing part of the deal. Reception was very helpful and polite, with prompt email responses to any questions we had. Our room was nice size with a comfortable bed, fast internet, and tiled, very clean bathroom with a large tub. The lobby restaurant was actually quite good. We only ate breakfast there - a large buffet, but the dinner menu del dia looked good (for 11 euros). It is located in a little town with a fair number of restaurants and tapas bars in walking distance. There is a metro stop into Madrid city center, but it is a few blocks farther from the hotel which made us decide to not go into the city at this end of the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: shasha59
Reviews.Content: We were at Clement Barajas hotel for only one night. Left the terminal across from the taxi stand there is a free shuttle bus to pick us up. We called them upon our arrival. It would cost about $30 Euro by taxi. The shuttle make 2 stops so make sure you get off at the right hotel. The receptionist were friendly and helpful. We were given a smoking room and changed it to non smoking room which was much better ( so make sure you made that request). The room was clean and beautiful. We had a corner room, so it was big and had a balcony. Too bad we were not staying there longer. The receptionist recommended us a tapas restaurant called La Caprichosa ( worth going there for dinner). They had a breakfast buffet about $7.50 Euro. It's a typical European kind of breakfast. I think it is worth it, much cheaper then eating at the airport. Give enough time to get to the airport, as the shuttle bus stop at another hotel, lots of rearranging luggages if the bus is full. I will definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stopover before your flight”
Reviews.Author: arubadreamer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Clement Barajas Hotel for one night before our flight to Mexico.I booked the room on line several months in advance and immediately received the confirmation.On our arrival we called to find out about their free shuttle and quite soon we were picked up and brought to the hotel. The room was comfortable with a good bathroom and a free WIFI. The breakfast was tasty and we had a discount since we booked on line. The staff was helpful and very friendly. We used the hotel's shuttle bus to bring us back to the airport.On the whole it was a very pleasant stopover before a very long flight and I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: danandrei
Reviews.Content: Plus: - free airport shuttle. It's stated clear that the shuttle bus comes upon phone request. The people say there is no shuttle bus didn't read the reservation note. If you call it comes in 5-10 minutes, if you don''t the bus will NEVER come - low-medium price - nice area in Barajas, lots of stores, supermarkets, restaurants around the hotel - free water and a juice in the room Minus: 1. the room is outdated. To be clear I'am talking about 207. No LCD, no wifi in that room (there is free wired and wireless Internet in the hotel but the signal was not strong enough in my room so a network cable is required). O tried both on my phone and on my laptop and wifi didn't work. 2. the walls are dirty. There are the dirtiest walls I've ever seen in a 4* Hotel. A renovation is required immediately. The room was not very clean. If someone from the hotel has another opinion I come with some photos. 3. the staff is not good prepared to give clear information. I was with a 3 year old child. I asked if the child should pay for the breakfast. The receptionist lady said: no idea you should ask a waiter :(( Ok I ask a waiter (who didn't speak good English at all) and she said: yes, he pays half, 4 Euro. This is not normal, a kid that stays with his parents in a double room shouldn't pay for the breakfast. No hotel in the word charge for that. The second day at the breakfast the child was not charged (as it is natural and normal). But there is no rule for that, it depends on the waiter. 4. no glass in the room. If you want to drink a bear or a wine in the room there is a problem. 5. The breakfast is good, but I consider it a minus because of the child incident described earlier and because of the fact that there is NO vegetable (tomato, cucumber etc). It's a medium hotel and I don't recommend it in case there are other possibilities.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Patricia_Ottaviano
Reviews.Content: I went to Clement Barajas hotel for the OMEXPO and it was a pleasant stay. The bathroom is very big and beatiful, and the breakfast is excellent. I would improve the WIFI, because it's not very good and update the TV. Other than that it was a good hotel and I recomend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location near airport”
Reviews.Author: barleyphs
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night prior to our flight back to the USA the next day. Modern, corporate style hotel. A metro stop in town of Barajas (walking distance) made it easy to take a quickie trip into Madrid to visit a few museums.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a stay near the airport!”
Reviews.Author: Renata_Bruciano
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with a free transfer from the airport. The staff was very friendly and helpful and let us leave the bags before check in and after check out. The rooms are very large, clean and bright! There are a lot of restaurants near the hotel and great places to go out at night. It's a far from downtown but very good if you need somewhere near the airport to stay.

Reviews.Title: “good for airport but dark room”
Reviews.Author: praha13
Reviews.Content: The Clement Barajas is well located, very near the airport and there is a free hotel shuttle bus to the airport. There is a metro stop nearby so it is easy to go to town, although a bit of a ride. The room though was gloomy. It was very dim and the walls were scuffed and needed repainting. I would say this was a 3 star hotel, not a 4 star.

Reviews.Title: “Will come back!”
Reviews.Author: henryworldwide
Reviews.Content: well the service as far as the shuttle was great and on time. Breakfast and lunch at the restaurant was also great. Very centric where you can walk 5-7 minutes to the train station. You will also get a feel of the little houses and buildings around the hotel which remind you of Spain great art. There is a little gas station acrosss the hotel where you can buy drinks and stuff late night. Soon will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money on this”
Reviews.Author: TheTravellingDane
Reviews.Content: They call it 4 star, I think they have paintede the last two stars themselves ! Welcome like "do I really have to work now" Okay room, bad cleaning. no extra in the room, minibar is two bottles of whater, one Cola. one tiny tiny "bottle" of shower/hair soap. windows extremly leaking, so cold in winther. Low quality restaurant from 13.00 to 16.00. No room service. Little bar "on kitchen chairs" from 17.00 to 00.00. No real bartender. Far from city center, 20 minutes from airport, do the last 15 minuttes, go to the city center and live there. Fast taxi service, fast to find you a good restaurant, free shuttle service to and from airport.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: irenemHongKong
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights in the Clement Barajas Hotel. We arrived at Madrid Airport and walked to the area where hotel buses arrive. We tried to phone the hotel on my mobile but my mobile would not work. We were just about to walk back to the airport and phone for the transfer when it suddenly arrived right in front of us so we were very lucky. The receptionist on the check in desk was polite and efficient. We had our room within five minutes. The room was clean and nice enough, though a couple of things were broken - part of the toilet seat, the door of the cupboard with the minibar. We had plenty of space, a room safe, a minibar with free water and juice. The bed was OK, but not the most comfortable I have ever slept in.Toiletries provided included shampoo, conditioner, soap, a razor, tissues. Our package included a welcome basket of fruit and bottle of wine which we paid 10 Euros for. That came soon after our arrival and was nicely presented. We got two six Euro vouchers for booking our room through the hotel's own website. We used these for breakfast. It should have cost 7 Euros 50 cents but we got it for 1 Euro 50 cents. At that price it was a brilliant deal. We had Spanish omelette, bacon, Iberian ham, cheese, delicious bread, coffee, juice, fried pieces of dough- just to try them. We thought breakfast was pretty good. Again staff were friendly. The hotel provided free wifi and we were able to print off our boarding passes for our next flight in their business centre. The business centre had two computers for guests to use. Barajas itself has a little town square, a church, some restaurants. We did not spend much time there. Instead we took the metro into Madrid. We took the train line 8 from Barajas to Neuvos Ministerious, changed to Circle line 6, went one stop to Cuatro Cominos Station then changed to red line 2 which will take you to Sol, Opera and most of the stations for sightseeing. It took a while but we were in no hurry. Changing lines involved lots of stairs, elevators, escalators etc. It was not just a short walk across the platform. We took the hotel's free transport back to the airport. You must book a day in advance. Our room was nice and quiet at night. I would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Convienient near to airport and great value”
Reviews.Author: Clavito2
Reviews.Content: Inexpensive hotel with the rooms nicely appointed, clean, nice and no noisy. Great customer service, very helful and courteous. The 24-hour free shuttle to airport is a great value added service. I highly recommend Clement Barajas for your overnight stay flying into and out of Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Return to Clement Barajas”
Reviews.Author: mvgregg
Reviews.Content: This was my wife and my second stay at the Clement Barajas. We had stayed at its sister Clement hotel, the Tach, upon arrival to Madrid this trip just to see how it compared to Clement Barajas and because it was slightly closer to a metro station; however, overall, I think I prefer this hotel. For an inexpensive hotel, the rooms are nicely appointed with nice wood work. The hotel has a nice restaurant, which we had eaten at before, but this trip we went to the town square of Barajas to a local restaurant recommended by the desk clerk. As others have noted, the reception staff are very friendly and the 24-hour free shuttle to and from the airport a value added service. I highly recommend Clement Barajas for your overnight stay flying into and out of Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Just for One Night”
Reviews.Author: Wijaya N
Reviews.Content: My daughter and myself just coming from Malaga so we have to be transiting for one night only in Madrid on returning to Frankfurt. Since shuttle was part of their service and we have no clue about Madrid or the hotel, at the website show how close they are to the airport but still if you are not familiar with the location and we were arrived at night so we have to wait for the shuttle. Unfortunatelly he bus came late, we were almost more than a hour just to wait. The hotel itself is quite simple, so since we are just for a night less than 12 hours we are not expecting anyhting with that price. Overall was good hotel and if I ever have to be on transiting again for few hours I might choose the place again

Reviews.Title: “Well priced overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: embax92
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of our Spanish holiday, caught the airport bus from the train station to connect with the free shuttle to hotel. Very efficient service and friendly staff, clean and well appointed rooms for the price, perfect for a relaxed overnight stay. A great family style restaurant & bar just along the road with a good menu and fantastic friendly staff-the best service we had during our holiday.

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jack377
Reviews.Content: We came from Morocco for an over-night stay on our way to Ireland. Hotel Clement Barajas was just perfect for us. It is close to the airport with easy access to town, located in the neighborhood of Barajas. The hotel is great, the staff exceptionally friendly and the rooms were beautiful. It is a really excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money for a quick stopover”
Reviews.Author: Spanishlizard
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for one night during August, for the purposes of a quick stopover night between an evening and morning flight. The hotel is extremely close to the airport, and operates a free minibus service, which you call when you arrive and book when you depart. We found the hotel to be very reasonable in terms of cost, and the staff were friendly and polite. We did not really use any of the hotel facilities as we were only there for a short time, apart from having a late night drink and snack before going to bed - I think the kitchen closes at 11pm, which was when we checked in. The only downside was that the room was not very clean - quite alot of hair on the bathroom floor, and some on the bedspread. We may have been unlucky, and as we were there for only one night, it did not really bother us, and we did not report it to the staff. Overall - a pretty good, value for money hotel. Charlie & Jane.

Reviews.Title: “They need to improve security!”
Reviews.Author: Earby
Reviews.Content: Had a bad trip made worse by a delay in my flight from Warsaw to Madrid, arrived at 9pm and needed to be up by 3am for a flight to Barcelona. While checking in with another couple I noticed two young men sitting at a coffeee table by the desk, I had put both my suitcase and briefcase on the floor. All of a sudden there was rapid movement and a shout from somewhere one of these blokes was trying to leg it with my briefacase, he got scared dropped it and ran, I went into kill mode and chased him, I am nearly 65 dressed in a suit, he was about 25 wearing trainers. No contest however he did not gate away with my kit. I think anyone sitting around reception without good reason should be checked out. However I did get room, which for the price paid €49 was exceptional, and so was the food and price of drinks. So left there 6 hours later, cant say any more than what I saw and eat was damn good.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed & loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: salvinoF
Reviews.Content: We good service & very resonable price, buffet breakfast for Eur7.50, free interent service and free drinks in fridge room

Reviews.Title: “A Friendly, Well Priced Quality Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MikeKinross
Reviews.Content: Well situated for Barajas Airport, the hotel is modern, clean and well appointed. The reception staff are very friendly and helpful. We stayed overnight before catching a plane home to Edinburgh. We were given an upgraded room with one of the fanciest massage showers I've ever seen (though some of the functions didn't work) and a sizeable verandah which looked out over the rooftops of Barajas town. The hotel is quite close to a metro station (though a bit further away than we'd been led to believe) and it was relatively easy to travel into Madrid centre. As I recall, we had to change trains three or four times (not a difficulty, however) but the ticket cost only 1 euro. The hotel has a courtesy bus which travel;s regularly - every hour on the hour - to the airport and there are lots of seats on board. So there's no need to stand or worry about not being allowed to board. Half board was included in the price. The buffet lunch was good but we cxouldn't take breakfast since we'd to leave at 7am and breakfast doesn't start until then. To be fair to the hotel, however, they did provide coffee and biscuity snacks in the bar for travellers like ourselves. All in all, a very good hotel and one which I'm more than happy to recommend highly..

Reviews.Title: “Been there before and will be back!”
Reviews.Author: rcrews
Reviews.Content: We frequent Spain and the Clement Barajas is the hotel we choose every time we are preparing for departure back to the states. It has excellent service, great food, clean rooms, and is accommodating in every way. A bonus--the shuttle will take you to the airport free of charge; just be sure to book your spot on the shuttle the night before. We love it. Don't speak Spanish? No problemo! Their personnel speaks fluent English. Muy bueno! Adios.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for an overnight near Madrid airport”
Reviews.Author: flightwithadutchman
Reviews.Content: If you have to stay overnight near Madrid airport, this hotel is a good choice. I have tried to book a few more times afterwards and quite generally they're among the first places in Barajas to be full. Barajas is about 10 minutes from either terminal 1/2/3 or 4 and all hotels there have a shuttle connection to their hotel from selected pick-up points at the terminals. With your GPS in hand you could also take the metro into Barajas and walk to the hotel, that's about 10 minutes away. You're on the mainline connection from Madrid airport into town anyway so Barajas is convenient not only for airport overnight stays. The hotel is great: clean, good rooms and a superb buffet style breakfast. And the shuttle to the airport. A recommendable place.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: juncool
Reviews.Content: Spent for the early-morning flight from Madrid. The hotel was very good and it was nice to stay there. The bus to MAD was very punctual and the hotel service before we left the hotel was also nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great for an early airport departure”
Reviews.Author: LostProfessor
Reviews.Content: I spent one evening here with my adult daughter on the last night of a trip to Spain, prior to an early departure the next morning. This hotel was an incredible value and included a free shuttle to the airport. The room was clean, nicely furnished and had a spacious, well-appointed bath. The front desk staff was very helpful and spoke excellent English. This is a simple 10-minute walk to the metro station and about 30 minutes -- with two transfers -- to downtown Madrid (Plaza Mayor).

Reviews.Title: “Close to airport”
Reviews.Author: MelissaEl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the night before our flight home. Hotel was close to Barajas metro stop. Clean spacious rooms and decent hotel lounge food. Front desk coordinated our airport shuttle and wakeup call right at check in. We had no problems using the van as other travelers experienced. Only negative was VERY thin walls which greatly affected our sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location, but attencion with transport to airport”
Reviews.Author: ViniciusR
Reviews.Content: Best location of Madrid Barajas Airport. The room is nice. Attencion with the free transport of the hotel to Barajas Airport, because the transport is only at hour, and along more than 25 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: mklost
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in this "4 Star Hotel", when We were leaving for the airport, we were comming down with 8 bags and the recepcionist told the shuttle driver to remove some bags we already have placed inside the bus because it shouldn't wait for us, We lost our flight and had to buy other tickets... don't you dare to complain, they actually beleive they are paying you for staying there If you want to waste money, time and stressed out, this is your place, otherwise go somewhere else

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended hotel close to Madrid Airport”
Reviews.Author: BarbaraCCanada
Reviews.Content: Agree with comments from 10th July from Australian guest. This is a gem of a hotel. We booked it the evening before leaving Canada with a cancellation clause due to volcanic polution. We only needed it for one night as we had guaranteed reservations in Segovia the following evening. It was a real find. The shuttle picked us up shortly after we called at 7am and they allowed us to check into our hotel room immediately without extra charge..a nice touch. The hotel is minimalistic in style and spotlessly clean. Staff were friendly and gave us good info and maps to navigate the town of Barajas and get to the metro. The buffet lunch was good value and quality at 8 Euros. The breakfast was adequate, not a big choice but sufficient and the only hotel to serve churros....Yum!! At 70 Euros a night, including free WIFI, I would stay here again and have already recommended it to several people. Unfortunately when we needed to stay an extra night on our way home, it was already booked solid but it was our first call. Location in the centre of Barajas is great and we had a wonderful evening at the main plaza, eating and people watching!

Reviews.Title: “Great option for a madrid visit”
Reviews.Author: Travel_addict13_10
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great alternative to staying in the expensive heart of Madrid. Close to the airport and with a free shuttle bus, it is easy to access. It is, however, in the village of Barajas so it pleasant to walk around the village or find a restaurant for dinner and feel very much part of Spain rather than just attached to an airport. It is only a 10 minute walk through the village to the metro station and then an easy 45 minute trip into the centre of Madrid. The hotel is modern inside with all the expected amenities for a 4 star hotel. The buffet breakfasts were wonderful with such variety from continental to English to German. The hotel stored our bags, free of charge, while we went to Granada for a few days. My dealings beforehand via email were easy and the hotel staff were helpful and responsive with all my requests. I would certainly stay there again when visiting or passing through Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for overnight stay pre or post flight”
Reviews.Author: queenheart
Reviews.Content: Booked because of reviews here...was not disappointed nice clean efficient hotel close to airport. surrounding not wonderful but OK. Has afew shops and quite afew restaurants. Tried one which was generic and Ok in price. Rooms are quiet and well appointed..ours face the street in front and not a problem, this is a secondary street. There are small grocery stores nearby and some clothing stores etc...plus the asian bazaars which now are everywhere in spain...they are akin to dollar stores. Done be put off by that they can have some great stuff for cheap. Ate at a amercan/english type pubish place...OK and not over priced....exit the hotel and go to your left...about one or 2 blks on same side of street. Serves american type fare mixed with some spanish. Nothing to rave about just food when hungry. Clean and fresh. Parking is underground and very tight corners they even have rubber mats on the walls on some corner! They have Free internet...huge plus...room was approx 60 euros I think a great price for the quality....but dont think about much culture and vibe on the outside.....airport hotel whcih served extremely well. Would stay there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Close to Airport”
Reviews.Author: Dannyk1
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised with this hotel. The staff we encountered spoke English and were all quite friendly. Took the shuttle multiple times to and from the airport without a hitch. The rooms were nice and clean with good sized bathroom. Bed was very comfortable and seemed quiet for sleeping at night. They had a few complimentary beverages in the hotel refrigerator such as juice, soda and water which was a nice touch after a long trip. In the lobby are a few computers with a printer so you can print boarding passes, check in etc. Pretty sure they have wireless internet in the rooms. Very close to airport. Not the best choice if you are looking to stay near downtown. However, maybe eight blocks away is a metro (subway) station that leads downlown - really not a bad walk or bad metro ride. Front desk provided street map to metro and then a map of the metro routes. Being near the metro you can go about anywhere. We rode to Atochoa train station and Chamartin train station with our luggage with no problems and feeling safe. We used this hotel as our base in Madrid. They graciously stored some of our luggage while we traveled to southern Spain and France. This little perk made this hotel a great place to stay. We stayed here 3 nights at different times.

Reviews.Title: “Aiport Hotel- Good value but let down by the shuttle service”
Reviews.Author: dselvan
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel since had a early morning flight and hotel was near the Barajas airport and they had 24 hour shuttle service. Unfortunately had to wait around an hour at the airport and shuttle only arrived after 2 phone calls. No apologies offered at the time and no reasons were given either considering the hotel is only 5-10 mins drive from the airport. The management since then have emailed to apologise and they are investigating the matter. Having said that the return to airport early next morning was on time. Room was good and large with comfortable beds and nice shower/ bathroom. Had the usual amenities including safe and free wifi. Had the buffer diner which was basic and unexciting but reasonable price. Staff were good and very helpful (apart from the shuttle incident) and spoke good english which was good since my spanish was poor!! Overall if it wasn't for the shuttle would have 5 stars and i have no problems recommending this if you have to stay near the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Fantasitc Hotel, Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: MissPicks
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a fantastic location and offers a free shuttle to and from the airport and is only a 10min walk to the nearest metro that takes you to the centre. the service and advice offered by the staff was fantastic, they where very helpful and gave us great advice. The rooms where fantastic and very very comfertable and clean and in a very quiet location, I would definatly return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and staff. Free airport shuffle!”
Reviews.Author: Ga_bi_91
Reviews.Content: My friend and I choose to stay at the Clement Barajas because it offered a free shuffle service to the airport. We were really pleased with it - everything from the decor to the breakfast buffet (not included) was of very good quality. Our room had twin beds, closet, TV set (although we didn't use it), an arm chair and a desk. The bathroom was very nice and everything was perfectly clean. We didn't hear any noise at night, so I suppose the walls and door were soundproof. The staff was super friendly and helpful. We arrived quite early and they still gave us a room (after a while - we had breakfast in the meantime) even though we were there before the ususal check-in time. It is a bit far from the closest underground station (Barajas) - about 7 to 10 minutes walking (around 700m) - and I think there should be some signal posts to indicate the way to the hotel since it's not located on the main road (Av de Logroño). The shuffle service itself was pretty efficient. We booked our seats in the 4 o'clock one since our flight would depart around 6:00 and we were afraid we might miss it if we got the 5:00 shuffle (it runs every hour; takes about 20/30 minutes to get at the airport). I definitely recommend this hotel if, like us, you need to get at the airport very early in the morning (before the metro is open).

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Nice hotel near airport”
Reviews.Author: Gail114
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at this hotel and the staff were fabulous. The shuttle was very prompt. We called from the airport when we arrived and the shuttle was there in just a few mins. The desk clerk offered info on the nearby square where we walked to while waiting for our room as we were early. He also provided info on using the metro which we did for both days. The walk to the station is about 10 mins and it's another 45 or so downtown but it only costs 1 Euro! Madrid is a beautiful city, so much to see. Room was quite small but otherwise very comfortable, nicely equipped bathroom, comp minibar with non-alcoholic drinks. Morning coffee at the bar which was nice. Would definitely recommend this hotel if you want to be near the airport especially. Good restaurant called Okela a few mins away on Ave Logrono and also little stores open late to pick up milk, beer, a banana, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: eeplebneesta
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel simply because the price was right, it was close to the airport, and accessible via Metro from central Madrid. What a pleasant surprise! The hotel is very modern and really felt like a spa/resort experience! There is also a free shuttle to the airport! We were there on Good Friday so had to eat at the buffet-was ok but not as good as the rest of the experience. Not much going on in the neighborhood as far as cafes,etc. I would absolutely stay here again if I weren't staying in central Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Great landing pad, Stress-free convenience”
Reviews.Author: copingINcanada
Reviews.Content: Stayed here both upon arriving in Spain, and before departing. Took advantage of their airport shuttle each time - there was a small difficulty communicating with the hotel to arrange pickup, but considering that my Spanish is extremely poor, this is to be expected. If you only speak English, they are equipped to help you, but some patience will be required. Upon arrival at the hotel, check in was easy, and they even allowed us to check in considerably early which was most appreciated after a long flight. The room was very nicely decorated, quiet, and comfortable, and the whole hotel is immaculate. All the amenities you would expect are here, including WIFI, which we later learned is something that should not be taken for granted in Spain. All of the staff are friendly and helpful, and the price is quite reasonable. If your plans are firm, you can book directly with the hotel and pay upfront, which will save you some euros. We didn't try the on-site restaurant, but there is a nice place a few doors down called Al Traste which we frequented. There are some other little restaurants around as well, but not geared for touristas. The metro is only about a 15 minute walk away - it will take you just about anywhere you want to go in the city and is very easy to navigate (puts the TTC to shame!). If you are looking for a place close to the airport to reduce stress and don't mind a little walking and transit to get to the sights, this is definitely the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, small good quality”
Reviews.Author: russ-the-rover
Reviews.Content: The free shuttle bus was at the hotel bus stand outside T3 when I got there, so great, only a short bur ride to the hotel. The hotel staff are friendly and helpful, and speak good English. The room is not the biggest but certainly not pokey. The bathroom is nice and modern with a pack on essentials like a sawing kit, shaving kit ect. The only slight down side is the bed, but I don’t often find a bed to my liking in a hotel. The location is great, lots of small café’s and restaurant’s in the area, but the hotel food is good. It is about 5mins to the metro station and with one change will take you into the city centre, get the €5.20 tourist ticket and it gives you unlimited travel on the metro and buses for 24hrs.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, too bad about the service.”
Reviews.Author: Karolee_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the end of March. On the Sunday (first full day) we asked directions to a particular area in Madrid. The Customer Service Attendant gave us a Metro lay out and a map. He told us how to get where we wanted to go. The only problem was IT WASN'T WHERE HE CIRCLED. Not only that, it wasn't even ON THE MAP he provided. Fortunately we read the street signs and made our way back. It wasn't difficult but it was a dirty, nasty trick. I would recomment the hotel but your service attendants should be told how unacceptable this is.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: JaneyG_10
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Madrid airport and rang the hotel for the free shuttle service which collected us from the airport and took us to the hotel. Very efficient service at the hotel. We had a buffet dinner in the cafe which was okay. Breakfast in the cafe was much better. Room very good but we really missed the tea and coffee making facilities, although room service was available.

Reviews.Title: “Location and value can't be beat!”
Reviews.Author: DrVito
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot and have pretty high standards when it comes to hotels. This one had it all: a perfect location for an airport hotel, super-clean and comfy rooms, very helpful staff, and dependable (and FREE!) shuttle service. It's 5 min from the airport by shuttle bus and only a 5 min walk to the Metro (in case if you want to take a trip downtown Madrid). Rooms very very nice and hip, although the bed mattress wasn't the most comfortable (you could feel the springs inside). There's also free WiFi throughout the hotel and free water, soda and juice in the minibar. I booked it on booking.com and at 60 Euros per night, it was an amazing value for a 4 star hotel. The only small downside is that the shuttle bus runs once an hour every hour, so for my 6:15 am flight I had to leave the hotel at 4 am. Nevertheless, I would highly recommend this hotel and will stay there again if my travels take me to Madrid again.

Reviews.Title: “A nice, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: ShinChengMu
Reviews.Content: Our flight would arrive Madrid at around midnight, so we chose this hotel mainly for its location and the shuttle bus service. Apart from these features, however, the hotel itself is also nice, clean, with friendly and helpful staffs. Before the trip we emailed and called to confirm that they will be running a shuttle bus that evening. The shuttle bus is supposed to run every hour, but we were still recommended to make a phone call in the airport. The room is nice and clean. The hotel has a beautiful bar and a lobby, with newspaper, computer, and printers. Due to time difference we felt hungry at around 4 or 5 that evening, and we were happily told that they offer some free muffins at the bar during the evening. This does not cost much, but is really helpful when you need it. The hotel is about 10 minutes away from the nearest subway station. Not too close, but still within walking distance. Overall it is very convenient for people who need easy access to the airport and the city.

Reviews.Title: “An unsafe hotel”
Reviews.Author: BichetteCalifornia
Reviews.Content: While I was having breakfast at 7:30 in the cafetaria in the hotel my bag (passport, money, credit cards and everything else) were stolen from the chair I was sitting on. The hotel staff was just awful: They did not offer any help. The only thing I was told was "go to the airport they will help you there" It was a huge disappointment. The commercial smile had totally disappered from the faces. This 4 stars hotel is obviously unsafe!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location for an early flight out”
Reviews.Author: BobRWR
Reviews.Content: We had an early flight out of Madrid Barajas so had our friends drop us off here the night before. Very clean and friendly. Bed was two twins together though. They managed to get our wakeup call wrong, but fortunately I woke up in time. Excellent shuttle service to airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay if you are taking a flight.”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoVoyager9
Reviews.Content: Couldn't ask for more. Had everything we needed before our flight out of Spain.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Dutchie48
Reviews.Content: I booked this Hotel after I read some of the reviews. We needed a place close to the Airport as we rented a car for a week, back at the airport, after visiting Madrid. The shuttle service is great. It leaves the Hotel every hour ON the hour. Waiting at the airport for it to arrive, might take a bit, no need to phone them, as it won't make a difference. We booked it for 2 nights, and before we left Spain, we booked it again for our last night before flying back to Canada. The best thing we did, as driving around Madrid, can be a bit confusing. They are about a 7 minute walk to the Metro, and it takes you where ever you want to go. We were up and walking around Down Town Madrid before 9 am, on our first morning there. We booked the Hotel using their own website, and got a good deal, with buffet breakfast included. Hotel rooms are clean, and beds are great! The WIFI works awesome, you just need to ask the front desk for the log in password. A few minutes walk brings you to a nice little square where you can sit and enjoy your first Tapa's, surrounded by locals. Breakfast buffet is great, we did the supper one once, but that we would not recommend, there are better places in the neighbourhood. They have a restaurant on site too, but we did not try it.

Reviews.Title: “Completely satisfied”
Reviews.Author: Canadiansky
Reviews.Content: Even if you do not need an airport close by, this hotel is worth a stay. It is located in a nice little village and is quiet despite being practically at the airport. Check in and out were friendly, efficient, and professional with English speaking staff. Our two rooms were clean with very comfortable beds and lovely bathrooms. Yes, there is complimentary water, juice and pop in the mini fridge! Staff were pleasant and very accommodating. Buffet dinner in the hotel restaurant was good value but did not appeal to all, and we would have gone to a local restaurant if less tired. Salads and desserts were great but the meat eaters were disappointed. Buffet breakfast was very good. The shuttle bus service was perfect - on time, clean, pleasant and driven by a careful and considerate driver. Shuttle to the airport takes less than 30 minutes for Terminal 1 which is the last stop. We also used the shuttle from the airport after dropping the rental car, which was even faster. We were very impressed and satisfied with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Transit Hotel near Barajas Aeroporto.”
Reviews.Author: Catalanvisitor
Reviews.Content: As I have previously mentioned I have found this site to be invaluable when travelling to Spain. In point of fact, I actually stayed at Clement Barajas on the recommendations of fellow trip advisiors. Such is the power, and value of this site. I arrived at Barajas after a long flight from Australia. What happened to me is, I suppose to some extent commercial reality. I finally located the slip lane that is allocated for small hotel buses. Note it is located to the RIGHT as you walk out the main exit. Surprisingly, the porters and others that I asked did not seem to know its location ( yet it was less than 100 metres away). Maybe they want you to use taxis or alternate transport. In any case I had real problems when phoning the hotels as the phone was always engaged. Finally, i asked a Green Airport guide to try and they got through ( not straight away). After waiting more than half an hour the transport arrived and I arrived at the hotel which is just a short distance from the airport. Taxis do NOT want to take you as it is not worth their while. The Hotel desk was manned by ONE person and so iwaited my turn. I watched carefully for the phone to ring. After a short time it rang, but was left unanswered on several occasions. Are you getting my drift.?? But when you actually read the hotel guidelines " transport is provided when they are able to do so. So this does NOT mean when it is when you require it. ### To be fair, as i always try to be it is a SMALL hotel by Spanish standards. The front counter service was efficient, friendly and my questions about transport OUT the next day were answered. Naturally, I wanted to be certain of a bus the next day which met MY deadlines. I had no problems. My deal included breakfast which was the full deal. Absolutely top hole, everything you could want, well presented, with fresh fruit and plenty of it. The room was as has been described by others. Double bed, modern s/c bathroom. I would use this hotel again when i go to Spain. My mark would be high say 8.5. It does have the limitations I mentioned. This must be balanced against the reasonable price, the proximity to the airport, great breakfast etc. Catalanvisitor

Reviews.Title: “The choice in Madrid!”
Reviews.Author: Fortaleza_7
Reviews.Content: You cannot go wrong with this hotel. Extremelly clean, staff very attentative, close to the airport, and just 35 min. from downtown by subway. If you're not in Madrid to party, this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “It is our hotel in Madrid when we fly out of Barajas”
Reviews.Author: WallySoria_Spain
Reviews.Content: This is our hotel when we have an early flight out of Barajas. We live in Soria and find this a very suitable overnight stop. Have had no negative feedback after staying there 4 times. Keep up the good work!Free transportation to the airport and close to long term parking. Barajas villa is a nice little village to eat in.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: tlasp
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Clement Barajas immediately prior to our trip home. After our endless activity during the time we were in Spain the choice to spend our last night here and take advantage of the free shuttle was a good one. Our room was nicely furnished and sparkling clean. Minibar contained free bottled water. The breakfast buffet was good. Internet is available in the rear of the lobby area and the staff was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: MIACRUISER
Reviews.Content: Perhaps the most convenient Hotel when you travel to Madrid and need to stay near the airport. Free shuttle. Excellent location. Most impressive staff. Great customer service. Would definitely recommend to all my friends, family and business colleagues.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: TimmyJamesB
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and i stayed here for only one night after a tour of Spain as we had a very early flight the next morning. We stayed here primarily to take advantage of the complimentary 24 hour shuttle bus to the airport. We arrived early in the evening and were tired from an all day bus ride. Check in was a breeze and the two staff members at reception were both very helpful, they also spoke English very well. I asked about the free wireless internet while I was checking in and they gave me the password and said if it wasn't working to my liking I could get a cable from them (which I did and from there it worked great). The room was fairly spacious and very clean. The bed was comfortable and we had an excellent sleep. There was a nice big TV in our room with cable including a few English speaking channels and also a complimentary Coke, juice and water in the fridge which was nice. The bathroom was clean and spacious, there was also a bath. We checked out at 4.45am and the staff offered us to help ourselves coffee and biscuits while we waited for our shuttle bus, a nice gesture considering we didn't pay for any breakfast package because we knew we wouldn't be there for breakfast. Even though we were only there for 12 hours or so, it was a great stay and way better than spending the night in terminal 4, which is what we were going to do.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Great Staff, Great Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: TravelBugConnecticut
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here upon the completion of a two week trip in Spain as we had a morning flight out of Madrid. Everything was great including the staff, the shuttle service to the airport etc. We arrived in the evening before our flight and headed to the local tapas bars for dinner and drinks. The room was quite nice and the bathroom was top notch. Could not have made a better choice and it was at a reasonable price. Very nice. Would recommend without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Airport”
Reviews.Author: cycledallas
Reviews.Content: If you need to be close to the airport for a flight our the next morning, this is the place for you. It's located in the small town of Barajas (for which the airport was named), has a free shuttle to and from the airport and is within walking distance of a number of small restaurants if you want to enjoy a meal. They also have a small bar and substantial breakfast buffet available for 8 euros/person. You can also use their computer for free internet use.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: psc27
Reviews.Content: Service: Excellent service, complimentary shuttle service always on time, people at the front desk always willing to answer my questions. Breakfast: I couldn't take breakfast at 4 am at the hotel so they offered for free some madelaines and cofee to go. Internet access: the hotel have 2 computers in the lobby and I could even print my e-tickets before I left. The hotel also offers wi-fi but I didn't get the chance to use it. Rooms: perfect size and huge and impecable bathroom, very clean Location: I chose this hotel because I had to take a flight very early in the morning so it being near to the airport was ideal. The Barajas metro station is also walking distance (5-10 minutes) if you want to visit the city center for a while (aprox. 30 minutes to get there), the neighborhood felt safe.

Reviews.Title: “amazing”
Reviews.Author: ripap70
Reviews.Content: it's just amazing. I stayed at this hotel just for one night but it was more than enough to give it a 5 star review. The free shuttle service was really quick , they picked me up in just 10min. The room was big enough and very neat. The hotel is very close to the Barajas metro train station so even if you're staying just for one night you can visit the city center without problems. At last but not least, the staff!!!!.... they' were amazing , really helpful, thank you.....I recommend this hotel to everybody.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable if you're flying out”
Reviews.Author: MiketenB
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a quiet village close to the airport. Ideally located if you're flying out early the next morning. There's a free shuttle to the airport. The rooms are clean and are of a good size. We got a good deal on booking.com otherwise we would have stayed at one of the other hotels in the area. We did have an issue with the restaurant which was supposed to be open between 8.30 pm and 11.30pm. When we went down at 9.30 pm it was dark and shut. The only thing open was the brasserie which was offering a rather horrible looking warm and cold buffet. We decided to find a restaurant in the village. All-in-all a rather boring, quiet night before an early morning flight - which is a good thing, I suppose.

Reviews.Title: “Good value near airport.”
Reviews.Author: ColemanNative
Reviews.Content: Clean room, comfortable bed, excellent bathroom. Prompt complimentary shuttle from airport. Free WIFI. Room service was prompt with good food and wine. Front desk staff fluent in English. Only complaint was that I couldn't determine how to adjust the thermostat so slept with the windows open and the street is noisy. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not your average airport hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Wheesht!
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night due to an early flight the following morning This hotel is perfect for the airport and is not just a base standard which is the norm for airport hotels. The room was comfortable and spacious with a good size and appointed bathroom. Staff were very helpful and arranged the free airport shuttle with ease. We stayed in the hotel for dinner and had the buffet, which for under 10 euros per person was exceptional. All in all a very good stay. The metro is 2 euros for a one way trip to the centre of Madrid, 30 minutes away, so you could use this as a base for a longer stay. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Just a word: Terrific.”
Reviews.Author: reietto
Reviews.Content: We stay at Clement only two night but is terrific. When we arrived in Barajas airport call the hotel and in 10 minutes they arrived and pick me up. Then we had book a coach service for next early morning at 4.30 . Rooms are very nice and soundproof, personal was very kind and driver too. We couldn't ask better.

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel. Bad customer management relations.”
Reviews.Author: Rufus D
Reviews.Content: Nov. 6, 2008. Management was not the least bit responsive to my questions about billing, i.e. Carlos Gomez. Several emails and handwritten letters were completely ignored. This is no way to treat a paying client.

Reviews.Title: “It does the job perfectly”
Reviews.Author: Lancashire user
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night to enable us to catch our 6.30 am flight. As we only arrived at 8pm we did not have much chance to test the facilities but everything we needed in the circumstances were carried out efficiently. Check in was friendly and efficient. Booking the airport transfer was easy. The room was well equiped and comfortable except that the bed was too hard for our liking. We did not eat here but there seemed to be two eateries in the hotel. In the morning the early call was on time, the check out simple and the transfer to the airport took only about 5 minutes. We used the metro to get from central Madrid. This involves a 10 minute walk to get from Barajas metro station to the hotel. So the hotel offered all you need from an airport hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wojon
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it was close to the airport and we had an 0630 flight. We were surprised at the excellent value and quality of the hotel, from the room to the staff and the restaurant. Although it was a 40 minute metro ride to the centre of Madrid, the metro was easy to use and the convenience of a 24 hour shuttle to the airport was enormous. Small touches like the free soft drinks in the minibar (rather than expensive alcohol) and free computer usage downstairs, made it even better.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding "Airport" hotel”
Reviews.Author: landcruiserBJ
Reviews.Content: After a couple of nights in central Madrid we had an early flight on day 4 and wanted a hotel close to the airport on the third night. We got the metro out to the airport and called the hotel for the shuttle, it arrived just 18 minutes later. Staff were friendly and helpful with a good command of English, the hotel was clean throughout and our room was well equipped - including a complimentary non-alcoholic mini bar. Free wifi is available throughout and there are a couple of “free to use” computer terminals available in the lobby. We booked a 5.00 am shuttle for our trip to the airport, there was complimentary coffee and cakes waiting for us in the lobby prior to our short shuttle trip to the airport. This hotel has got it right, you could ask for nothing better from an “airport” hotel. We will definitely use it again when needing accommodation near Madrid airport.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Catherine K
Reviews.Content: What I love about this hotel is the staff goes above and beyond what is expected in assuring their guests are comfortable and secure. I stopover-ed here for one night in June from Seattle to Tenerife. There is actually a massage available in your room which I scheduled last minute. Wonderful after 20hrs of travelling! This was also my one night last stop before my early flight home in July. I had shipped luggage to this hotel 2 weeks prior, in order to lighten my load for the rest of the trip. Upon check in, and without asking the front desk clerk said it was here waiting. Shuttle pick up was easy and efficient at the airport, and was scheduled next day on both occasions. The rooms are comfortable with great baths, and my air conditioning worked great. There is a small bar and restaurant on the ground floor w/room service available. Best deal was on the hotel website. Absolutely no problems and I would definitely stay again. Previously I prefered the Sofitel at Barajas-however this hotel is half that price with similar amenities and a staff that really appreciates your business.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good, but here's a suggestion for improvement”
Reviews.Author: Oz tallboy
Reviews.Content: We were conducting a week long training course near the Barajas airport recently and so selected this hotel (for ourselves and the course participants) from its competitors. Our selection was partly based on reviews here on TA. By and large we were happy with our choice. Most of the positive aspects discussed in previous reviews were accurate. However the one thing that bugged me was that it was impossible to iron (press) a shirt without sending it to the hotel laundry, which cost in the region of EUR 5 per shirt. This is probably not an issue at all for many customers of the hotel who may be passing through on a one or two night stay / during a holiday. However, staying at the hotel for a week and wanting to look professional for work each day it becomes an issue. I stay at many hotels all around the world and this is the first time in quite some years when I have not been able to iron shirts myself. Most often the room comes equipped with an iron and ironing board, or at least room service can provide one, usually for the duration of the stay. Worst case scenario is that you are provided with access to an ironing room or facility elsewhere in the hotel. However, with the Clement Hotel this was not possible and the only solution was to have the shirt pressed by housekeeping. I regard this as poor business practice, especially for a hotel that is clearly pitching itself at the local convention market. We are scheduling to conduct another course near Barajas soon and will be reviewing our choice of hotel. If you don't need or care about ironing, the Clement is a very good airport hotel, and the town of Barajas, while not overly attractive, has some good options for eating and drinking within easy walk of the hotel. I would particularly recommend restaurant Al Traste, a fun and inexpensive eating house with friendly staff about 100 meters to the left after exiting the hotel. Just a note about internet access ~ I didn't have a problem using the complimentary wifi in my room, but a couple of colleagues could not connect and so used the terminal provided down in the foyer.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel by the Airport!”
Reviews.Author: SerendipitySari
Reviews.Content: Tripadvisor does not lead you astray here, this is one great hotel near the airport. The staff spoke enough English so we could communicate, the rooms are nice, the lobby is great and you get free wireless! I'd stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Better than an airport stopover”
Reviews.Author: UKGill1
Reviews.Content: This hotel so far exceeded our expectations of a need-a-stop airport hotel that we chose to make lives easier for ourselves and stay on the way back. Staff very friendly. Breakfast excellent with real fresh fruit, eggs, meats, breads... Room well sound-insulated enough to cope with the teenagers next door. Internet connections no problem at all as cable was provided free for fast LAN access when the wifi was struggling (built up area and a crane over the adjacent building). Airport transfer a vast improvement on many that have been done - even when we gave them the wrong terminal on the first visit, we were retrieved with a smile. Even better: the service in all departments is genuinely included. No US-style hands-out-at-all-points. This is Spain showing that it knows its market and can deliver with that extra touch of humanity that just makes the world go round.

Reviews.Title: “Very Convenient, Perfect for Jet Lag arrival”
Reviews.Author: kyoto5301
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Clement Barajas the day of arrival from the US. Our main goal was to sleep off the jet lag, and it was perfect for that. Because we had a rental car, we didn't want anything too taxing in terms of the directions. We found the hotel simply. Parking was not a problem. There is a secure underground garage. It is a bit tight, but, not any different than any garage you will find in Europe. The lobby and the room were clean, pleasant, and tasteful. We had a balcony which let us look over the roofs of the houses in town which made us feel that we had actually made it to Europe despite our exhaustion! The breakfast buffet was very good. Staff was solicitous. We had an excellent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Short, but great stay”
Reviews.Author: SEG_Canada
Reviews.Content: Had an early flight and wanted a hotel close to the airport. I got to the Madrid train station from Granada late that night. Took the metro out to the airport and called the hotel for the shuttle. The shuttle was there in less than 15 minutes. Staff were friendly and helpful. Booked a spot on the shuttle (4:30 am) for my flight the next day. Only slept here a few hours but the hotel room seemed very nice and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: deedee80
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel the night before our departure from Madrid Our room was small but clean and reasonable There is a restaurant in the hotel that has very reasonable rates for meals. The staff was very friendly, eager to help and patient. They went out of their way to assist us. They agreed to store our luggage a week before our arrival even though the room was not paid for yet. Shuttle service is free (some hotels charge a fee) and as advertised. We called from the airport and they picked us up in 10 minutes. You have to reserve a shuttle service to the airport in the morning which is reasonable as they operate only one van. The hotel provides free internet access. The attitude of the staff makes it a pleasant experience. Highly recommended if you need to stay next to the airport

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel but awkward to get to and from”
Reviews.Author: an_spalpeen
Reviews.Content: The Clement is a reasonably good hotel. I was however a bit disappointed over because with a TripAdvisor ranking of 9th in Madrid I was expecting a great hotel. I selected this hotel as I had an early flight the next day to Latin America. I thought that staying near the airport was a good idea. The first problem I encountered was that the taxi drivers at the airport won't take you on the relatively short distance to the hotel, unless they charge you an exorbitant fare that is. I was quoted 30 euro for a fare that should have been between 5 and 10 euro. I naturally declined this offer and went with Plan B - the hotel shuttle. I called the hotel and they told me that the van would be there in 10-15 minutes. Half an hour later I called again and was told the same thing. 40 minutes after my initial call, the van finally arrived and brought me to the hotel in 10 minutes. The hotel room was OK but nothing special. For 117 euro a night I expected something special. I have stayed in other hotels (e.g. some NH Hotels) in the centre of Madrid for little more than half this amount. Most of the other reviewers seemed to like the Barajas neighbourhood and to be happy that an airport hotel had some life beside it. My goal was to spend time in the city centre. As I was already an hour later than I had hoped to be on check in, I took a taxi to the centre and one back again which cost me over 50 euro total. In the morning I was told that I would have to wait for an hour for the shuttle to the airport as I hadn't booked a seat on it. Instead I took a taxi which cost me 10 euro. The hotel is full of signs and disclaimers saying that the shuttle service is offered as an "extra" and that guests don't have a right to a seat on the shuttle, must book in advance, etc., etc. All of that is fair enough. But what is the point of this hotel?? Do the management really think that people want to spend time in the Barajas area? If it wasn't beside the airport no one would stay in this hotel. Therefore easy transit to and from the airport must be the priority. I have a suggestion for the hotel management: instead of applying rules, regulations and disclaimers, why not buy a second shuttle and improve the service? Personally I wouldn't stay here again. I prefer to take the metro to some other hotel close to the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat location”
Reviews.Author: Livingabroad1
Reviews.Content: You can't beat this hotel for location. It's situated in a pleasant street, with shops/restaurants/bars. We thought we'd be staying in the middle of nowhere but it was perfect for an overnight stay and the airport transfer was ten mins max. Just had to phone from the airport to say we'd arrived and the free shuttle bus came. Advised to book the bus at hotel reception when we arrived for the following day which we did, and that went smoothly. We needed a cot and that arrived quickly. Hotel itself: clean, modern, simple, friendly young staff, nice bathroom with toiletries, good shower. Rooms a decent size. Only downside: Rooms were quite warm as don't think they had air con and when we opened the window in the night it was quite noisy. But would still stay there again. Had a look around whilst there, however, and Hotel Melia Barajas looked ok (very spacious) and appeared to be another and alternative good option. Rooms were quite nice, perhaps a little smaller than Clement. At night: Recommend the little square at the end of the road (turn right out of hotel) for a beer and olives. Lovely setting. Restaurant (American style) Al Traste ('Fun and Food'): left out of the hotel about 150yds. Good atmosphere, yummy nachos and ribs. For young children: Further on from Al Traste there's a play area with sand. Nice place to go after dinner (early for the spanish, 8pm!)

Reviews.Title: “Aiport hotel, in great little neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: Oceanwaves13
Reviews.Content: I didn't have the opportunity to feed back at the time, but having booked into what I thought would be a faceless chain hotel on a 6-lane highway somewhere near the airport, I was charmed to find it in the centre of a bustling residential area with small shops, bars and cafes. The hotel was modern and very comfortable, the staff very helpful (they provided a basic breakfast before my early departure at 05.30 at no charge) and both relaxed and friendly. It is located in a working neighbourhood - so don't expect fancy shops or cafes, but it is a welcome departure from the usual experience of being trapped in an airport hotel surrounded by endless roads and cargo bays.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel airport”
Reviews.Author: metoocka
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel the nights of March 16-18 (2 nights), 2008. We were enroute to Israel but decided to stop in Madrid for 2 days, to do a little sightseeing. We wanted an airport hotel, rather than one in downtown Madrid, because we didn't want to drag all of our bags from the airport to downtown and then back. An airport hotel with accesss to a train was a better idea. The only problem we had was figuring out how to call them from the airport. Before we left the U.S. we were told that after baggage claim there will be a desk we can go to and they'll call for us. Unfortunately, I couldn't find it and was misdirected repeatedly. Finally someone at another desk was kind enough to call the hotel for us and the van arrived within 15 minutes. But from the moment the van arrived it was smooth sailing. The driver was great and the ride was under 10 minutes. The lobby was attractive and the staff at reception was wonderful. We received our room key and went upstairs in under 5 minutes. The room was lovely. Modern, stylish and welcoming decor; nice and rather large bathroom. The room was large enough for our needs (two adults and a 2 year old). Someone else wrote that it was too small for an American's taste, but really, how large does it need to be? We had enough room to walk around comfortably, and the baby had room to play. There was lots of closet space and the safe was very easy to figure out. After freshening up we went downstairs to "hit the town". Elena at the front desk was especially helpful. She provided us with subway maps and detailed directions about how to walk to the subway station (about 12 mins walk from hotel) and which trains to take in order to get to downtown Madrid. On the way to the train we discovered a playground for the baby, so we stopped to let her run around. Upon our return in the evening there was a delicious, all-you-can-eat dinner buffet for 8 Euros. The only thing is that dinner doesn't even begin until 8:30 pm so we were very hungry. But there was lots of food to choose from. The next morning Elena was helpful again in directing us to a local mall where we could buy some items we needed. She also told us how to get back on track and continue on to Madrid when we finished at the mall. Later that night we enjoyed the dinner buffet again and told the front desk what time we'd need the airport shuttle in the morning. Everything about this hotel was absolutely wonderful, including the courteous and attractive English-speaking staff. We would definitely stay there again if we needed a lovely hotel near the Madrid airport. Gracias!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience.”
Reviews.Author: avaric
Reviews.Content: We spent the night of March 30, 2008 at the Clement Barjas Hotel in Madrid....it was a jewel. The room was spotless...the staff very friendly and accomodating...I had caught a flu bug the afternoon I arrived and since it was a Sunday all the pharmacies were closed...the front desk staff gave me some medicine to take that got me through the night. They arranged our shuttle to the airport and our wake up time during the check in procedure. While checking in we asked for a cot to be sent up to our room and by the time we stepped off the elevator the cot was being set up! The room was a bit small...but being an American most things in Europe are smaller than I am used to. If you are looking for a place to stay in Madrid that is convenient to the airport you could not do better than the Clement Barajas.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel w/convenience to Airport”
Reviews.Author: lucyAtlanta_GA
Reviews.Content: This is a beautifully done hotel. Had read some reviews before we booked and new to expect a new hotel in an area not frequented by a lot of tourists but it really was very nice. The shuttle picked us up in a matter of minutes and delivered us to the front door. The room was very nice - lovely decor and luxurious linens. The front desk staff couldn't have been friendlier. The price was great - only 97 euros for a Saturday night. The neighborhood didn't seem so bad - had ready in reviews that it was questionable. We walked down the street to La Traste for dinner, it was very good and convenience. Banks close by and a lovely park a couple of blocks away. Only stayed one night as we were at the end of our trip and flying out early. That was the main reason we booked there and it was a nice way to relax and spend our last night in Spain.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: flyhighvaca
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a very nice stay. The rooms were all well decorated and clean. They had free airport shuttle 24 hours a day. The staff was very nice. You do however have to call them when you get to the airport for the shuttle to come and it took them 20mins. Over all I would recommend this hotel to everyone near the airport. Nothing much to do around the hotel, it's more geared to the people who need to be near the airport

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a layover”
Reviews.Author: LisaBeagle
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very conveniently located to the Madrid airport, the shuttle service is convenient, the rooms are spacious and clean and well-appointed, the staff is very friendly and helpful, and the small town has sufficient amenities for an overnight stay. The hotel was just what we needed for our 14-hour lay-over ... a great hassle-free place to rest during our flight home.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect when your plane is leaving early”
Reviews.Author: Georgetta
Reviews.Content: Because our flight left at 06:30 a.m. in the morning we stayed the last night in Madrid at the Clement Barajas hotel.
